sense.name: dismiss or disregard as trivial or untrue
sense.examples: You shouldn't discount the possibility of him coming back. We had already discounted the theory that they were involved. He took care not to discount his wife's accomplishments.

sense.name: reduce the price of something
sense.examples: I never discount these books. They sell like hot cakes. Sign up for six months and we'll discount the price by 15 percent. The failure of prices in an oversold area to react to bearish news can be taken as a warning that all the bad news has been fully discounted in the current low price.
